alert.note: Alert for Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Martin County through 545 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Andy, or over Inez, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Warfield, Beauty, Calf Creek and Pilgrim around 530 PM EDT. Hode and Oppy around 535 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
